definition: at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: “If there's a real hash, the client can get infections,” says Kingsley.
sentences.chinese: “如果处理失当，客户可能会感染，”金斯利说。

sentences.english: This problem was not properly handled.
There have also been instances where members of the public have reacted inappropriately to displays of naked art.
sentences.chinese: 民众对裸体艺术展览反应失当的事件也时有发生。

sentences.english: Besides he mentioned that the treatment by HK Sanitarium was negligent and improper.
sentences.chinese: 另外，他又指养和医院治疗时疏忽失当。

sentences.english: Currently there exists a great amount of inappropriateness in quotes in Chinese journalism.
sentences.chinese: 目前我国新闻报道在引语使用方面存在大量失当现象。

definition: to fail in observing or supervising/to miss/to let sth slip through
not to do one's best/not to exert oneself
to lose one's job/unemployment/not to fulfill one's obligations/to neglect one's job/dereliction of duty
to slip/to overlook by negligence/careless omission/oversight
to fail to pay sufficient attention to/to be negligent in regard to/to be lacking in
to cause a loss of (decorum, dignity etc) (used in fixed expressions)
to neglect one's duty/dereliction of duty/malpractice
